items.sentence: Tom just wants to spend a little more time with Mary.
Tom didn\'t have the heart to refuse Mary\'s request.
Tom didn\'t have to take a taxi. He could\'ve walked.
Tom didn\'t have to talk to me if he didn\'t want to.
If I had had more money, I would have bought the pen.
For the past 10 years, I\'ve fed my dog dry dog food.
Tom said he had never seen anything like that before.
Tom will never live up to his parents\' expectations.
Tom asked Mary if he could read her mother\'s letter.
Tom died in the ambulance on the way to the hospital.
Tom died of rabies after having been bitten by a bat.
Tom dislocated his collarbone while playing football.
Tom disobeyed a direct order from a superior officer.
Tom thought Mary would probably fail her French test.
Tom thought that maybe Mary and John were gunrunners.
Tom threw his half-eaten sandwich into the trash can.
Tom told Mary not to waste her money on such a thing.
Where were you? We\'ve been looking all over for you.
While you\'re waiting, get yourself something to eat.
A lot of people look up to you. Don\'t let them down.
According to the weather forecast, a storm\'s coming.
I\'m not certain Tom is the one who stole my bicycle.
I\'m not even going to try get Tom to do that for me.
I\'m not going to be able to finish this before 2:30.
I can\'t tell you exactly what time we\'ll get there.
The next time I\'m in Boston, I\'ll try to visit you.
I\'ve just been to the post office to send a package.
I\'ve learned some interesting things from this book.
I\'ve written a list of questions for you to ask Tom.
Whatever happens, I want you to know that I love you.
We had a very nice Christmas with Tom and his family.
We\'re still trying to convince Tom to go to college.
Let me read the paper when you have finished with it.
Mary pretended she was sick to avoid going to school.
My brother in Boston is studying to become a teacher.
He was wrong in thinking that she\'d come to see him.
Do you really think Tom\'s wounds are self-inflicted?
I wish Tom hadn\'t told Mary that I didn\'t like her.
Boston is just one of the cities I visited last year.
Can one person really make a difference in the world?
Can you spare me a few minutes of your valuable time?
Tom took a drink and then offered the bottle to Mary.
Tom took off his clothes and stepped into the shower.
Tom took off his shoes and put on a pair of slippers.
Tom tried to convince Mary that it was time to leave.
Tom tried to say something, but Mary interrupted him.
We\'re going to have to make some very tough choices.
What makes you so sure that this won\'t happen again?
I should\'ve gone camping with you guys last weekend.
I should\'ve told Tom that was the reason I did that.
